comments.body: nit: FailStage or FailureStage might be more suitable
There are two stages that can fail, one is the StageConnect, the other is the StageProxy. FailStage doesn't sound like the right fit.

This is just for establishing a connection to the proxy, right? I think something more like `{.001, .002, .005, .01, .05, .1}` is better. The proxy has no reason to ever reach the higher numbers here, right?
No, this is establishing the tunnel all the way to the destination. Given that, do you think the current bucket reasonable?

Just to be clear, that's `apiserver -> proxy server -====-> proxy agent`? Or is it `apiserver -> proxy server -====-> proxy agent -> destination`?

And this is just opening the connection, not sending any data, right?

I sure hope that's never anywhere near 12.5 seconds. I think buckets from 5ms to 5s should be good?
